greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = ((-1)^(n+1)*A002425(n)) modulo 6.
comment: Let S(1)={1} and S(n+1)=S(n)S'(n) where S'(n) is obtained from S(n) by changing last term using the cyclic permutation 1->5->1, then sequence is S(infinity).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65536
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences that are fixed points of mappings
program: (define (A035263 n) (let loop ((n n) (i 1)) (cond ((odd? n) (modulo i 2)) (else (loop (/ n 2) (+ 1 i))))))
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 30 2003
